data.fullContent: One of the most popular options to get in shape is to use a home gym. There are so many options, especially with the popularity of more expensive and hi-tech machines. However, if you are looking for something that will yield better results in less time, you really need to consider a free weight approach. Free weights offer numerous benefits, including less chance of injury, faster development of strength and speed, and greater muscle development. The most important benefit of free weights is the fact that you are learning to balance and stabilize your body in one single motion versus the multi-targeted twisting and turning in order to gain the same benefits. The nature of free weight exercises also engages more muscle fibers from the very beginning of every repetition, which can result in increased efficiency and a more complete exercise.

q2.translation: 最受欢迎的健身方式之一就是使用家庭健身房。选择太多了，尤其是随着更昂贵和高科技的健身器械的普及。然而，如果您正在寻找在更短的时间内产生更好结果的方法，那么您真的需要考虑自由权重方法。自由举重有很多好处，包括更少的受伤机会，更快的力量和速度发展，以及更好的肌肉发展。自由重量最重要的好处是，你正在学习在一个单一的动作中平衡和稳定你的身体，而不是为了获得同样的好处而多目标的扭转和转弯。自由重量练习的本质也是在每次重复练习的一开始就需要更多的肌肉纤维，这可以提高效率和更完整的运动。

The nature of free weight exercises also engages more muscle fibers from the very beginning of every repetition, which can result in increased efficiency and a more complete exercise.

options.sentence: Weight machines are a popular addition to a home gym, as they can help you train multiple different muscles in isolation.
They are not strong enough to do the work, lift weights, do the running, take on the full program, or to push up the weight.
However, if you are looking for something that will yield better results in less time, you really need to consider a free weight approach.
Instead of arguing for or against machines or free weights, many fitness experts are recommending both together to build strength and size.

options.sentence: Free weight exercises engage more muscle fibers from the beginning of each repetition, which can result in increased efficiency and better results.
Researchers used a variety of exercises to measure muscle strength and endurance, including leg presses, leg curls, and leg extension exercises.
The subjects in the free weight group increased in strength by an average of 7.66%, while the machines group did not improve.
Exercise did not result in significantly greater improvements in strength or body fat mass compared to taking a mind-body approach to strength training.
